body:
So here's the situation. I have both GCC and PGI in my `compilers.yaml`. GCC does not have any compiler flags, but PGI does:
```yaml
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: centos6
    paths:
      cc:  /soft/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-5.3.0/gcc-6.1.0-q2zosj3igepi3pjnqt74bwazmptr5gpj/bin/gcc
      cxx: /soft/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-5.3.0/gcc-6.1.0-q2zosj3igepi3pjnqt74bwazmptr5gpj/bin/g++
      f77: /soft/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-5.3.0/gcc-6.1.0-q2zosj3igepi3pjnqt74bwazmptr5gpj/bin/gfortran
      fc:  /soft/spack/opt/spack/linux-x86_64/gcc-5.3.0/gcc-6.1.0-q2zosj3igepi3pjnqt74bwazmptr5gpj/bin/gfortran
    spec: gcc@6.1.0
    target: x86_64
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags:
      cflags:   -tp=haswell,sandybridge
      cxxflags: -tp=haswell,sandybridge
      fflags:   -tp=haswell,sandybridge
    modules: []
    operating_system: centos6
    paths:
      cc:  /soft/spack-0.9.1/opt/spack/linux-centos6-x86_64/gcc-4.4.7/pgi-16.5-pa5hji6khmosol3h7u65zhw6cy2dnekn/linux86-64/16.5/bin/pgcc
      cxx: /soft/spack-0.9.1/opt/spack/linux-centos6-x86_64/gcc-4.4.7/pgi-16.5-pa5hji6khmosol3h7u65zhw6cy2dnekn/linux86-64/16.5/bin/pgc++
      f77: /soft/spack-0.9.1/opt/spack/linux-centos6-x86_64/gcc-4.4.7/pgi-16.5-pa5hji6khmosol3h7u65zhw6cy2dnekn/linux86-64/16.5/bin/pgfortran
      fc:  /soft/spack-0.9.1/opt/spack/linux-centos6-x86_64/gcc-4.4.7/pgi-16.5-pa5hji6khmosol3h7u65zhw6cy2dnekn/linux86-64/16.5/bin/pgfortran
    spec: pgi@16.5-0
    target: x86_64
```
Now I want to build `openmpi` with PGI, but `libpciaccess` can't be built with PGI, so I tell Spack to build it with GCC instead:
```
$ spack spec openmpi %pgi ^libpciaccess%gcc
Input spec
--------------------------------
openmpi%pgi
    ^libpciaccess%gcc

Normalized
--------------------------------
openmpi%pgi
    ^hwloc
        ^libpciaccess%gcc
            ^libtool
                ^m4@1.4.6:
            ^pkg-config@0.9.0:
            ^util-macros

Concretized
--------------------------------
openmpi@2.0.1%pgi@16.5-0 cflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" cxxflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" fflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge"+java~mxm~pmi+psm~psm2~slurm~sqlite3+thread_multiple+tm~verbs+vt arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
    ^hwloc@1.11.4%pgi@16.5-0 cflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" cxxflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" fflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
        ^libpciaccess@0.13.4%gcc@6.1.0 cflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" cxxflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" fflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
            ^libtool@2.4.6%gcc@6.1.0 cflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" cxxflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" fflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
                ^m4@1.4.17%gcc@6.1.0 cflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" cxxflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" fflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge"+sigsegv arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
                    ^libsigsegv@2.10%gcc@6.1.0 cflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" cxxflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" fflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
            ^pkg-config@0.29.1%gcc@6.1.0 cflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" cxxflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" fflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge"+internal_glib arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
            ^util-macros@1.19.0%gcc@6.1.0 cflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" cxxflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" fflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
    ^jdk@8u92-linux-x64%pgi@16.5-0 cflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" cxxflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" fflags="-tp=haswell,sandybridge" arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
```
The problem is that although Spack will now correctly build libpciaccess and its dependencies with GCC, it is still trying to use the PGI compiler flags, which will fail.
title: Changing compiler in dependency does not change compiler flags
